basics.name: Tim Hårek Andreassen
basics.label: Full-stack developer
basics.summary: I'm a developer from the west coast of Norway. I care about creating solutions that respects people, in terms of privacy, security and user experience. I have a bachelors degree in informatics, specifically Computer Security. Presently I'm working as a technologist at Netlife Design, and I'm also an IT manager for an offshore-service company, Vest Kontakt.

work.name: Netlife Bergen
highlights: Tech lead role with a responsibility for multiple technologists.
Held internal workshops.
Held presentations about technology and UX at the University of Bergen.
UX-designer for REN.no and logged in area.
Full-stack development with Craft CMS, Sanity with Next.js, Vue and Deno.

work.name: Vest Kontakt
highlights: Transitioned a lot of manual processes to a digital medium, i.e. CRM, accouting software, etc.
Provided IT support for employees, both remote and on-site.
Re-designed their website, with modern technologies.
Created a more efficient system for their annual inventory.

work.name: Freelance
highlights: Working for Netlife Bergen.
Development on KHdele's website.
Development on One Ocean Expedtion's website.

work.name: University of Bergen
highlights: Provided technical support for students and lecturers.
Part-time job beside my bachelors-degree.

work.name: InfoCare
highlights: Computer-repair of Dell and Lenovo computers, both laptops and desktops.
IT support at ABB Bergen Kokstad.

work.name: Appex
highlights: Pilot project Sildikon Valley 2019 in Haugesund.
Developed a cross-platform AR-app for a local real-estate company.

work.name: PSS Securitas
highlights: Responsible for maintaining Norwegian alcohol laws.
Part-time job as a bouncer beside my studies in Bergen.

work.name: Forsvaret
highlights: Compulsory military service stationed at Ulsnes, Hundvåg, Stavanger.
Responsible for seven other soldiers.

volunteer.name: friByte
highlights: Maintenance and operation of IT systems for student organizations in Bergen.
Setup of different services for automatic deployment of other services.
Configuring a easy to maintain script for checking server availability.
Setup of Mattermost, moderating channels and maintaining channel workflows.
Initiate Ansible-workflow for maintaining servers.

volunteer.name: friByte
highlights: Administrative tasks, convene meetings etc.
Re-designed their website.
Currently restructuring their server-infrastructure.
Simplifying how the organization operates and responds to inquires.

volunteer.name: Studentradioen i Bergen
highlights: Contributed on the development of their new website.

education.summary: Computer Science with a security focus.
